image.altText: a person stretchered to an ambulance at bondi junction

props.synopsis: An attacker has killed five people at the Westfield Bondi Junction shopping centre in Sydney's east, while several others are in a critical condition.

title.children: Five people killed in knife attack at Sydney shopping centre, several others critical

image.altText: emergecny services outside bondi junction westfield after stabbings

props.synopsis: NSW Police Assistant Commissioner Anthony Cooke says five people are dead, with several others taken to hospital in serious condition as a "result of the actions" of a man carrying a knife at Westfield in Bondi Junction. Follow live.

title.children: Five people dead at Sydney shopping centre after reports of multiple stabbings and shots fired

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: NSW premier to return to Sydney
BREAKING: Five people dead, Assistant Commissioner Cooke says
PM says Australians' thoughts are with those affected

image.altText: A police officer and vehicle at a crime scene.

props.synopsis: Authorities say the pair involved in an alleged stabbing at a small Queensland town, which led to a man being shot by police, were family.

title.children: Men involved in alleged fatal stabbing leading to police shooting lived together

image.altText: A small house with a thatched roof surrounded by trees and a line drapped in clothes.

props.synopsis: When a woman was accused of using witchcraft in PNG to kill a young boy, she was attacked and left for dead. She survived thanks to the help of strangers and a safe house offering refuge for victims of sorcery-related violence.

title.children: The sudden death of Elli's relative led to her being branded a witch. She barely escaped with her life

image.altText: NSW Police tape

props.synopsis: Police were called to Gulgong near Mudgee this morning following reports of a concern for welfare.

title.children: Two bodies found in shipping container in NSW Central West

image.altText: A view of Jewel casino across Vila Bay at Iririki Resort, with hibiscus flowers in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The Jewel casino once stood at the turquoise shores of Vanuatu's Iririki Island — until its new owners shut it down. Their reason? "The house always wins."

title.children: Two Australian businessmen bought a casino in a tropical paradise — only to shut it down

image.altText: Marc Pittonet tackles Reilly O'Brien during the Blues and Crows

props.synopsis: GWS has defeated St Kilda by one point after leading by 35 during the final quarter. Carlton faces a winless Adelaide at Docklands. Follow live.

title.children: Blues and Crows locked in arm wrestle, Giants count injury cost of one-point win

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Izak Rankine gets his boot to ball on the goalline
HT: Carlton lead by six as Crows hang in the fight
Durdin breaks deadlock with a great goal

image.altText: A man runs the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: The Eels are hosting North Queensland after the Warriors and Manly play out a thrilling 22-22 draw, featuring a controversial penalty in the last minute of regulation that sent the game to golden point. Follow live.

title.children: 'You just can't hit the kicker': Warriors force golden point with last-minute penalty, but Manly clash ends in a draw

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: IT'S A DRAW! Nothing can separate Manly and the Warriors
88' Shaun Johnson misses a shot at field goal

image.altText: Joe Biden is pictured from the side as he leaves his Marine One aircraft.

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden warns Tehran not to proceed with an attack on Israel — something he expects "sooner, rather than later".

title.children: Biden says he expects Iran to attack Israel 'sooner rather than later'

image.altText: Grampian rescue 2020-12-19 11:12:00

props.synopsis: Rescuers tell of stumbling on a distressing scene on a little-used hiking trail as a fun family adventure threatened to turn into a tragedy.

title.children: Little 'heroes' and two bushwalking strangers save father after cliff fall on remote track

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and glasses walks down a street.

props.synopsis: Despite distracting allegations, there's really only one thing anyone wants to know from the decision in the Bruce Lehrmann defamation case: Does the judge think, on the balance of probabilities, Bruce Lehrmann raped Brittany Higgins?

title.children: As the judgment in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial approaches, one question rings out loudest

image.altText: Vivian sitting at home.

props.synopsis: These men have all badly hurt a partner or relative. They've even done time for it, but can they change for good? The ABC has been given exclusive access to a program that is helping them turn their lives around.

title.children: This was the moment a man who'd spent 30 years in and out of prison decided to retire

image.altText: Two men with brooms outside a home cleaning up mud after heavy rain.

props.synopsis: Locals in Perth's northern suburbs are cleaning up after an unexpected wild storm dumped more than 130 millimetres of rain.

title.children: Perth locals assess damage after freak storm tears through northern suburbs

image.altText: A smiling girl in a primary school uniform holds up a book while her dark-haired mum kneels beside her.

props.synopsis: Screen time is a big issue for many parents and educators, but when safely managed it can help children develop creativity, according to an expert.

title.children: Eight-year-old Liesel has just published her first book and safely managed screen time made it possible

image.altText: A group of people and rescue workers wearing helmets walk along a grey tunnel.

props.synopsis: Ten days after Taiwan's earthquake trapped people inside Taroko National Park, three people remain unaccounted-for, including Australian-Sinaporean couple Sim Hwee Kok and Neo Siew Choo.

title.children: For millions of years, the earth here has been rising up. Now two Australians are lost on Mysterious Valley Trail

image.altText: Two men in blue shirts taking photographs on a beach

props.synopsis: Liberals' candidate for the seat of Cook, Simon Kennedy, won't be able to personally boost voter turnout as his team confirmed he didn't move into the electorate in time to meet the registration deadline.

title.children: Liberal candidate to replace Scott Morrison can't vote for himself in tonight's by-election

image.altText: A road sign indicating a 60-kph speed limit.

props.synopsis: A motorist accused of travelling well over the speed limit has won his appeal, with the Supreme Court finding there was no proof the speed gun had been operated correctly.

title.children: Driver of car clocked 51kph over limit in Adelaide successfully challenges speed gun finding

image.altText: A Tasmania Police officer stands in front of a patrol car in Hobart's CBD.

props.synopsis: Police say a 29-year-old man, who was arrested in Hobart's northern suburbs in the early hours of Saturday morning, died soon after being taken to the Hobart Reception Prison.

title.children: Investigation underway after Tasmanian man dies in police custody

image.altText: a man wearing a grey shirt and blue jeans stepping into an empty cool room

props.synopsis: A remote Northern Territory community that has been cut off by flood damage now faces running out of food within a week, after six weeks without enough to go around.

title.children: Food shortage in remote NT community leaves some 'having to hunt cattle'

image.altText: Graffiti artist Byron Christensen  2024-03-22 11:03:00

props.synopsis: Port Macquarie street artist Byron Christensen has worked hard to turn his life around, and is now teaching graffiti classes to help other vulnerable young people do the same.

title.children: Graffiti was an 'escape' for Byron during a tough childhood. Now his story and skills are inspiring others

image.altText: Virginia Trioli pulls a weight machine towards her as she sits, smiling, in workout gear

props.synopsis: In the middle of a bushfire emergency, I tripped and sustained an injury that would deliver a sobering lesson in the universal experience of ageing. It was time to start taking care of my bones — by lifting heavy weights.

title.children: A scary fall in an emergency was a sobering reminder that ageing happens to all of us — yes, even you

image.altText: Sheridan Adams as Elphaba. She is holding a broom and surrounded by mist.

props.synopsis: It takes more than a great voice to sing Wicked's iconic song Defying Gravity. As the musical tours Australia, local Elphabas share how they deal with the challenges.

title.children: 'Elphabas have to live like monks': What it takes to perform one of the most demanding roles in musical theatre

image.altText: A woman holds an umbrella and stands on a beach in the rain. A cityscape is visible behind her.

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast has a booming population and a reputation for a vibrant nightlife, but the city's queer community is still struggling to thrive.

title.children: Why are queer people in this city of sun and sand so lonely?

image.altText: Man stands in front of a boat, ankle-deep in ocean water, looking pensively out to sea.

props.synopsis: The seafood company comes to the area to run Cone Bay Barramundi with a controversial reputation, but insists it wants to build a healthy relationship with the community.

title.children: Apprehension surrounds seafood giant Tassal's move into remote Kimberley coast

image.altText: The historic buildings of Cossack are closed heading into the tourist season.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's premier Roger Cook has been called to intervene and help reopen the historical Pilbara ghost town of Cossack, after a traditional owner group walked away during a dispute with the government.

title.children: WA Premier Roger Cook calls for ghost town dispute to be resolved

image.altText: A clear jellyfish with tentacles washed up on the sand

props.synopsis: Looking out over a busy beach near Mackay in north Queensland, Ross Gee says he feels powerless that hardly anyone is wearing a stinger suit while species like box jellyfish are at their deadliest.

title.children: Surf lifesaver who witnessed boy die from box jellyfish sting pleads for swimmers to suit up

image.altText: A woman sits on the couch and studies.

props.synopsis: Stephanie Grieve decided 2024 was the year she stopped putting her veterinary nurse dreams on hold. But with four children and 16 pets, full-time study via distance education is a balancing act.

title.children: Women more likely to return to study after having children, but for mums it's a juggling act

image.altText: Closed off street by police after Doonside stabbing 120424

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy will appear in court today charged with murder after two teenagers were stabbed, one fatally, in Sydney's west yesterday.

title.children: 16yo boy charged with murder after fatal stabbing near school in Sydney's west

image.altText: A man sits out the front of a house holding a concrete brick and smiling.

props.synopsis: With builders and materials scarce in post-war Australia,  Peter Hood's parents used ration coupons to buy cement to make bricks and build a house — which he still calls home today.

title.children: When building a new home meant making your own bricks — 10,000 of them

image.altText: A close-up shot of Donald Trump's face, with an annoyed expression.

props.synopsis: Former president Donald Trump urges Arizona politicians to swiftly "remedy" the state Supreme Court ruling allowing prosecutors to enforce a near-total abortion ban that he declares "went too far."

title.children: Trump pushes Arizona politicians to 'remedy' state abortion ruling that he says 'went too far'

image.altText: Golf star Tiger Woods takes his cap off his head on the final hole of his round at the Masters.

props.synopsis: Five-time champion Tiger Woods, at 48, makes the halfway cut at the Masters for a record 24th consecutive time as Cam Davis leads the Aussie charge at Augusta National.

title.children: Tiger Woods breaks Masters record as Aussie Cam Davis in the mix

image.altText: A drawing of a wombat with a runner's number and singlet breaking through a red finish line ribbon

props.synopsis: It's claimed a wombat can run faster than any human over a distance of 100 metres. Now, an exhaustive ABC investigation has tracked down the truth of the 40kph sprinting wombat myth.

title.children: How fast can wombats run? We dug into the truth of claims they can beat Usain Bolt
